intro: Alloplectus hoppii, commonly known as the Hoppi's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Alloplectus hoppii is adapted to arid conditions, with small, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss through transpiration.
